DOC.TEXT: Intel Seen Cutting Pentium Chip Prices : The company , seeking to keep rivals at_bay , is expected to cut_prices of its top-of-the-line Pentium chips as much as 25 % in the second_half of the year . For consumers , that means lower prices on fancy personal_computer systems in time for Christmas.Intel Corp. ' s microprocessors are the brains inside an estimated 75 % of the world ' s PCs . The cuts come as Intel seeks to present Pentium as the standard chip for PCs , aggressively cutting_into the market of companies that make clones of Intel ' s previous-generation 486 chips . It ' s also trying to ward_off competitive threats to Pentium from PowerPC , a chip developed jointly by Motorola Inc. , International Business Machines Corp . and Apple Computer Inc. Some analysts said the cuts could be even deeper -- as much as 45 % .
